snippet: A researcher at the Prado, using high-tech tools, discovered that a copy of the Mona Lisa was most likely painted by someone sitting next to Leonardo da Vinci as he produced his masterpiece.
abstract: Saturday Profile of Ana Gonzalez Mozo, Prado museum researcher who discovered that the museum's copy of the Mona Lisa was most likely painted by someone sitting next to Leonardo da Vinci as he produced his masterpiece.
lead_paragraph: A researcher at the Prado, using high-tech tools, discovered that a copy of the Mona Lisa was most likely painted by someone sitting next to Leonardo da Vinci as he produced his masterpiece.

headline.seo: Prado Researcher Finds Insights Beneath Copy of Mona Lisa
headline.main: Beneath That Beguiling Smile, Seeing What Leonardo Saw
headline.print_headline: Beneath That Beguiling Smile, Seeing What Leonardo Saw
